thread.title: Trinity football gets offense in rhythm on the road
thread.title_full: Trinity football gets offense in rhythm on the road

author: Mason Nesbitt
title: Trinity football gets offense in rhythm on the road
text:
Trinity football gets offense in rhythm on the road Knights pile up 32 points in 2nd quarter against Sherman Indian Posted: October 16, 2015 10:44   16, 2015 10:44 p.m. A A A 
Trinity Classical Academy was looking to get its offense in a rhythm on Friday night at Sherman Indian High in Riverside. 
And the Knights certainly did that in the second quarter when they piled up 32 points on their way to a 54-0 win. 
“It was a good game for us to work on our offense and get our young players more playing time,” said Trinity head coach Les Robinson. 
Knights quarterback Tyler Lee completed 14-of-23 passes for 154 yards and two touchdowns in the Knights' first game since a tough loss to crosstown-rival Santa Clarita Christian last week. 
Lee threw no interceptions against Sherman Indian (0-6). 
Caden Kulp ran the ball 13 times for 124 yards and two touchdowns. He also caught eight passes for 81 yards and a score for Trinity (4-2). 
The Knights led 6-0 after the first quarter and 38-0 at half. 
They tacked on eight points in the third and fourth quarters. 
"It's very important just to get back in the groove and get your timing and get your speed back up," Robinson said.
